definitions: long seat for multiple people typically made of wood or metal
place where judges sit in court or judges collectively
examples: The old man sat on the park bench feeding pigeons every morning
We installed new benches along the walking trail for hikers
The case will be heard before the full bench next month
She was appointed to the bench after years of legal practice

definitions: flat surface in kitchen or store where food is prepared or business conducted
device or person that counts things or calculates numbers
examples: She wiped down the kitchen counter after preparing dinner last night
The pharmacist stood behind the counter filling prescriptions all day
The electronic counter tracked visitors entering the museum each hour
Click counters help websites monitor their daily traffic and engagement

definitions: ratio showing likelihood of something happening compared to it not happening
state of disagreement or conflict between people or things
examples: The odds of winning the lottery are extremely low but people play
Bookmakers set odds based on their assessment of each team's chances
They've been at odds over the project direction for weeks now
His actions were at odds with his stated values and beliefs

definitions: long-tailed rodent larger than a mouse often considered a pest
person who betrays others or informs on them to authorities
examples: The rat scurried across the basement floor searching for food scraps
City health inspectors found rats in the restaurant's storage area yesterday
Don't trust him because he's a rat who tells everything to management
The gang discovered a rat had been working with police secretly

definitions: intense feeling of fear shock or disgust caused by something frightening
extremely unpleasant or shocking event or situation that causes distress
examples: She screamed in horror when she saw the accident scene unfold
Horror movies use suspense and gore to frighten audiences deliberately
The horrors of war left lasting trauma on the veterans' minds
Parents watched in horror as the playground equipment suddenly collapsed

definitions: action of stopping something from happening or arising before it occurs
measures taken to prevent disease injury or other undesirable outcomes
examples: Crime prevention programs focus on community involvement and better lighting downtown
Prevention of forest fires requires clearing brush and educating campers carefully
Disease prevention through vaccination saves millions of lives every year worldwide
The new safety prevention measures reduced workplace accidents by half

definitions: part of something that is separate or can be separated from whole
distinct group within a larger market or population sharing similar characteristics
examples: Each segment of the orange contains seeds and juicy flesh inside
The documentary was divided into three segments covering different time periods
The luxury car segment represents only ten percent of total sales
Marketing teams target specific customer segments with customized messaging strategies

definitions: flexible appendage extending from the rear of an animal's body
rear or bottom part of something especially aircraft or procession
examples: The dog wagged its tail excitedly when its owner came home
Peacocks display their colorful tail feathers to attract potential mates
The pilot checked the tail section during the pre-flight inspection carefully
She was at the tail end of the marathon runners group

definitions: process of putting a decision plan or system into effect practically
execution of a plan method or design for doing something specific
examples: The implementation of new software took longer than expected due to bugs
Successful implementation requires careful planning and adequate resources throughout the process
Policy implementation often differs from original intentions due to practical constraints
The implementation phase begins after all stakeholders approve the project plan

definitions: long narrow piece of material cloth paper or land
act of removing clothing covering or taking something away
examples: She tore a strip of fabric to bandage the wound quickly
The landing strip was barely visible through the dense morning fog
Workers had to strip old paint before applying the new coat
The court can strip citizenship from those who obtained it fraudulently

definitions: greater liking for one alternative over another or others
priority given to something or someone over other options
examples: Her preference for classical music influenced the wedding playlist choices significantly
Customer preferences change based on trends and seasonal factors each year
Veterans receive preference in hiring for many government positions nationwide
The software remembers your preferences for future visits to save time

definitions: information about reactions to a product or performance used for improvement
loud squealing sound produced when microphone picks up its own output
examples: Employee feedback helps managers improve workplace conditions and morale significantly
The teacher provides feedback on essays to help students write better
The feedback from the microphone hurt everyone's ears during the speech
Sound engineers work to eliminate feedback during live performances constantly

definitions: organized provision of medical services to individuals or communities
system of maintaining and improving physical and mental health through services
examples: Health-care costs continue rising faster than inflation rates every year nationally
Rural areas often lack adequate health-care facilities for residents' needs
The health-care system faces challenges from aging populations and chronic diseases
Many employers provide health-care benefits as part of compensation packages

definitions: person who has committed a crime or been convicted legally
relating to crime or the legal prosecution of crimes
examples: The criminal was sentenced to ten years in prison for robbery
Career criminals often start with minor offenses in their youth
Criminal law differs from civil law in penalties and procedures significantly
The criminal justice system includes police courts and correctional facilities

definitions: cylindrical metal container for storing food beverages or other materials
informal term for toilet or bathroom facility
examples: She opened a can of soup for a quick lunch today
Recycling aluminum cans helps reduce environmental waste and energy consumption
He excused himself to use the can during the long meeting
The portable can at the construction site needs emptying daily

definitions: person who purchases goods or services from a seller
professional who selects and purchases products for retail stores
examples: The buyer negotiated a lower price on the used car successfully
First-time home buyers often need help understanding the purchase process
The fashion buyer travels to Paris twice yearly for new collections
Retail buyers must predict consumer trends months in advance accurately

definitions: process of working together toward the same end or goal
willingness to be helpful and do what is asked or required
examples: International cooperation is essential for addressing climate change effectively worldwide
The project succeeded through cooperation between all department teams involved
We appreciate your cooperation during this security screening process today
Children learn cooperation through group activities and team sports gradually

definitions: paid occupation requiring prolonged training and formal qualifications
declaration of belief in a religion or faith
examples: Medicine is a profession that requires years of education and training
She chose teaching as her profession despite the modest salary offered
His profession of faith moved the congregation to tears last Sunday
The monk's profession ceremony marked his commitment to religious life

definitions: act of causing death of a person or animal deliberately
extremely exhausting or demanding activity that drains energy
examples: The killing of endangered species carries severe legal penalties worldwide
Police investigated the killing as a possible case of self-defense
That workout was a killing but I feel great now
Making a killing in the stock market requires luck and skill

definitions: person who takes photographs professionally or as a serious hobby
artist who uses photography as their medium of creative expression
examples: The wedding photographer captured every special moment of the ceremony beautifully
Wildlife photographers often wait hours for the perfect shot patiently
Famous photographers like Ansel Adams transformed landscape photography into art
The photographer's exhibition featured striking portraits of urban life

definitions: formal agreement to get married marked by giving an engagement ring
state of being involved with or committed to something actively
examples: Their engagement was announced at the family gathering last weekend joyfully
The engagement ring sparkled with a two-carat diamond in platinum setting
Student engagement improves when teachers use interactive learning methods effectively
Community engagement helps local governments make better decisions for residents

definitions: liquid substance applied to surfaces to color protect or decorate them
cosmetic makeup especially when heavily or garishly applied
examples: We need two gallons of paint to cover the bedroom walls completely
The paint was still wet so we couldn't touch the fence
She wore too much paint on her face for the photograph
Stage actors apply paint to be visible from the back rows

definitions: throwing of a ball especially in baseball to the batter
degree of highness or lowness of a musical note or voice
persuasive presentation intended to sell something or gain support
examples: The pitcher's fast pitch struck out the league's best hitter
Her pitch was right over the plate for a perfect strike
The singer's pitch was perfect throughout the difficult aria performance
Dogs can hear sounds at a much higher pitch than humans
The startup's pitch convinced investors to fund their innovative app
She rehearsed her sales pitch before the important client meeting

definitions: dish of mixed raw vegetables often served with dressing
cold dish of various ingredients mixed together with dressing
examples: She ordered a Caesar salad with grilled chicken for lunch today
The garden salad contained lettuce tomatoes cucumbers and carrots freshly picked
Potato salad is a popular side dish at summer barbecues everywhere
The fruit salad provided a refreshing end to the heavy meal

definitions: single step in a flight of steps inside or outside
series of steps leading from one floor or level to another
examples: Be careful on that broken stair near the bottom of the staircase
Each stair was exactly seven inches high according to building codes
She climbed the stairs slowly after her knee surgery last month
The spiral stairs led to a beautiful rooftop garden view

definitions: written or printed announcement giving information or warning
attention observation or awareness of something
examples: The eviction notice gave tenants thirty days to vacate the apartment
Posted notices warned swimmers about dangerous currents in the area
Did you notice the new painting in the hallway this morning
The change was so subtle that few people would notice it

definitions: smooth and elegant movement or manner of movement
unmerited divine assistance given for sanctification or salvation
short prayer of thanks said before or after a meal
examples: The ballerina moved with incredible grace across the stage tonight
She handled the difficult situation with grace and dignity admirably
Through God's grace the family found strength during their trials
Many believe divine grace can transform lives and heal souls
Grandfather always said grace before our Sunday dinner together
The children took turns saying grace at holiday meals

definitions: legal dissolution of a marriage by a court or authority
complete separation between things that were previously connected
examples: Their divorce was finalized after months of negotiations over assets
Divorce rates have changed significantly over the past fifty years globally
You cannot divorce economic policy from its social consequences entirely
The company's divorce from traditional methods improved efficiency dramatically

definitions: large boat or ship used for traveling on water
hollow container or tube for holding liquids or bodily fluids
examples: The cargo vessel departed from port carrying thousands of containers
Naval vessels patrolled the waters to ensure maritime security continuously
Blood vessels carry oxygen and nutrients throughout the body constantly
The ancient vessel contained wine from over two thousand years ago

definitions: domesticated animal with pink skin kept for its meat
person who is greedy dirty or unpleasant in behavior
examples: The farmer raised pigs for bacon and ham production annually
Pigs are actually intelligent animals despite common misconceptions about them
Don't be such a pig and save some pizza for others
He's a pig who never cleans up after himself ever

definitions: task or piece of work assigned to someone as part of job or studies
legal transfer of a right or property to another person
examples: The homework assignment was due by Friday morning without exception
Her first assignment as a reporter was covering local school board meetings
The assignment of the lease required approval from the landlord first
Patent assignment documents must be filed with the appropriate office

definitions: difference or contrast between similar things or people
special honor or recognition given for achievement
examples: The distinction between the two theories is subtle but important academically
She couldn't see any distinction between the identical twins initially
He graduated with distinction from the prestigious university last spring
The soldier received a distinction for bravery under enemy fire

definitions: complete path that electricity flows through including the power source
regular journey around a particular area or between particular places
examples: The electrical circuit was broken causing all lights to fail immediately
Engineers designed a new circuit for the computer motherboard carefully
The judge travels a circuit covering three rural counties monthly
The lecture circuit kept her busy traveling between universities constantly

definitions: chemical compound that releases hydrogen ions in water solution
substance with sour taste that can corrode metals
examples: Sulfuric acid is used in car batteries and industrial processes worldwide
The litmus paper turned red indicating the presence of acid
Acid rain damages buildings and harms aquatic ecosystems over time
Stomach acid helps digest food but can cause heartburn sometimes

definitions: ability to accomplish something with minimum wasted effort or expense
ratio of useful work performed to total energy expended
examples: The new system improved efficiency by reducing processing time significantly
Energy efficiency in buildings saves money and reduces environmental impact
The efficiency of the engine determines its fuel consumption rate directly
Workplace efficiency increased after implementing better organizational tools

definitions: structure or statue built to remind people of a person or event
service or ceremony held to remember someone who has died
examples: The war memorial honors soldiers who died serving their country bravely
They erected a memorial at the site of the tragic accident
The memorial service celebrated her life and many contributions beautifully
Annual memorial events keep the victims' memories alive for families

definitions: color between green and violet in the visible light spectrum
feeling of sadness or depression
examples: The blue sky stretched endlessly on the perfect summer day
She painted her bedroom walls a calming shade of light blue
He's been feeling blue since his best friend moved away
Monday blues affect many workers returning from weekend relaxation

definitions: thing with distinct and independent existence in reality or conception
organization or being that has a legal identity separate from members
examples: Each living organism is a separate biological entity with unique characteristics
The concept of the soul as an entity separate from body
The business entity must file its own tax returns annually
Government entities operate under different rules than private corporations

definitions: smartphone designed and marketed by Apple Inc with touchscreen interface
mobile device running iOS operating system with various models
examples: She dropped her iPhone and cracked the screen yesterday unfortunately
The new iPhone features improved cameras and longer battery life
iPhone apps can be downloaded from the Apple App Store exclusively
Many people upgrade their iPhone every two or three years

definitions: penalty inflicted for an offense crime or fault committed
act of punishing someone or the state of being punished
examples: The punishment for theft varies depending on the value stolen
Capital punishment remains controversial in many countries around the world
Parents debated whether punishment or positive reinforcement works better
The punishment didn't fit the minor nature of the crime

definitions: small round mass of medicine to be swallowed whole
oral contraceptive taken daily to prevent pregnancy
examples: Take one pill every four hours to reduce fever and pain
The bitter pill was hard to swallow without water
She's been on the pill for three years without any problems
The pill revolutionized family planning in the 1960s significantly

definitions: traditional story about heroes or supernatural beings explaining natural phenomena
widely held but false belief or idea about something
examples: Greek myths tell stories of gods and heroes like Zeus and Hercules
Creation myths exist in cultures around the world explaining human origins
The myth that we only use ten percent of our brains persists
It's a myth that goldfish have three-second memories actually

definitions: expert in economics who studies production and consumption of goods
person who analyzes economic data and trends professionally
examples: The economist predicted a recession based on current market indicators
Leading economists disagree about the best monetary policy approach currently
She works as an economist for the Federal Reserve Bank
Economists study how societies allocate scarce resources among competing needs

definitions: activity involving skill in making things by hand creatively
skill used in deceiving others or clever planning
examples: She learned the craft of pottery from her grandmother patiently
Traditional crafts are being preserved through apprenticeship programs nationwide
The spy used his craft to extract information undetected successfully
Writing fiction requires mastering the craft of storytelling completely

definitions: literary work in which language is used for aesthetic and evocative qualities
quality of beauty and emotional intensity in creative expression
examples: She published her first book of poetry at age twenty-five
Poetry uses rhythm metaphor and imagery to convey meaning differently
There's poetry in the way dancers move across the stage
The poetry of the sunset moved everyone to grateful silence

definitions: thin strand of cotton wool or other fibrous material for sewing
theme or characteristic running throughout a situation or piece of writing
examples: She used red thread to sew the button back on carefully
The thread broke while she was embroidering the delicate pattern
A common thread runs through all his novels about redemption
The discussion thread on the forum went on for pages

definitions: special right or advantage granted to a particular person or group
opportunity to do something regarded as a special honor
examples: Driving is a privilege that can be revoked for violations
Executive privilege protects certain presidential communications from disclosure legally
It was a privilege to meet the Nobel Prize winner personally
Many people don't appreciate the privileges they enjoy daily

definitions: black rock formed from plant remains used as fuel
piece of glowing or charred wood or other material
examples: Coal mining remains dangerous despite modern safety equipment and regulations
The power plant burns coal to generate electricity for the region
Hot coals from the campfire could start a forest fire easily
She drew with a piece of charcoal coal on paper

definitions: person who acts unwisely or lacks good sense and judgment
historical entertainer who amused royal courts with jokes and antics
examples: Don't be a fool and drive after drinking alcohol tonight
Only a fool would believe such an obvious lie completely
The king's fool entertained guests with witty observations and acrobatics
Court fools often delivered harsh truths disguised as humor

definitions: large domesticated animal kept for milk or meat production
adult female of cattle or certain other large animals
examples: The dairy cow produces twenty gallons of milk daily on average
Black and white cows grazed peacefully in the green pasture
The farmer separated the cows from the bulls for safety
A mother cow protects her calf fiercely from potential threats
